title: Ornamental Grasses Quiz
description: Ornamental grasses add movement and texture to landscapes! How well do you know these graceful garden plants?

questions.question: Which tall ornamental grass produces feathery silver plumes in late summer and can grow over 10 feet?
What ornamental grass has a fountain-like form with arching blades and fuzzy, bottle-brush seed heads?
Which compact ornamental grass forms blue-gray tufted mounds and is often used as an edging plant?
Miscanthus sinensis 'Zebrinus' is commonly called what because of its horizontal yellow bands?
Which native North American grass was once the dominant plant of the Great Plains prairies?
What is the best time to cut back most ornamental grasses?
options: Late winter or early spring before new growth
They should never be cut back

questions.question: Which ornamental grass is commonly used in Japanese-style gardens for its elegant, fine-textured blades?
Karl Foerster Feather Reed Grass is valued for what growth habit?
Which grass-like plant is not a true grass but is commonly grouped with ornamental grasses?
What ornamental grass turns brilliant shades of red and orange in autumn?
Pampas Grass is native to which continent?
Which low-growing ornamental grass is commonly used between stepping stones and as a lawn substitute?
What type of ornamental grass makes a rustling sound in the breeze, adding an auditory element to the garden?
Which ornamental grass variety 'Northwind' was named Perennial Plant of the Year in 2014?
What is the primary reason ornamental grasses are left standing through winter in many gardens?
options: For winter visual interest and wildlife habitat
